intro: Senapea guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan senapa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, cylindrical pods that contain several seeds. Senapea guianensis is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests.
